description:
go.net/spdy: do not expose SPDY frame types

This package provides typed frames instead of frame type values.

messages.text:
On Tue, Feb 19, 2013 at 7:46 AM,  <dave@cheney.net> wrote:

> Looks reasonable to me. I'd feel more comfortable if you could share
> some details about your plans for this package.

sure. I now plan to polish the spdy's basic framer API and its tests for
the next steps. this would be, a) twiddle code a bit idiomatic, b) drop
a redundant API surface, c) fix fragile tests for framers, d) reorganize,
change source file names to type-centric ones;
I mean s/read.go/controlframe.go/.

then, look forward to take a look at new cooked SPDY API proposals
that contains server, multiplexer, stream-based framer, blah blah from
jxck or other.

does this make sense?

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.net

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

On 2013/02/18 22:44:02, mikio wrote:
> Hello mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
> 
> Please take another look.

Looks reasonable to me. I'd feel more comfortable if you could share some details about your plans for this package.

LGTM. Please announce your intentions on golang-nuts first as you are changing the public API by removing exported symbols.

Please change the description to something like:

"unexpose ControlFrameType and Type* constants"

subject: code review 7337047: go.net/spdy: do not expose SPDY frame types
